newsitem.title: JAPAN: High oil prices push down Japan Nov 20-day surplus.
newsitem.headline: High oil prices push down Japan Nov 20-day surplus.

text.p: A drop in Japan's trade surplus in the first 20 days of November was mainly due to higher crude oil prices during that period which boosted the value of overall imports, a senior Finance Ministry official told Reuters on Thursday.

Earlier, the ministry said Japan's customs-cleared trade surplus for the first 20 days of November dropped 45.9 percent from a year earlier to 171.27 billion yen. Imports rose 17.4 percent year-on-year, while exports increased 8.4 percent.
The official also said the imports were concentrated in the second 10 days of November after imports dropped in the first 10 days of the month.
The 8.4 percent rise in exports could be described as a "normal rise" for the first 20 days of a month, he added.
